title.rendered: NAMIP Media Product Fellowship Program for Nigerian Students 2024

content.rendered:
The Nigeria Media Innovation Program, an initiative by MDIF aimed at supporting media organizations in maintaining their editorial independence and enhancing financial sustainability, is pleased to announce the launch of the Media Product Fellowship. This comprehensive program spans four months and aims to foster the development of product thinking, execution, and business acumen among emerging media practitioners. Additionally, it seeks to aid newsrooms in their pursuit of sustainability by embedding these Fellows within their organizations.

Selected Fellows will undergo an intensive three-week training program, focused on practical learning, to enhance their expertise in media product development and business strategies. Subsequently, they will be assigned to newsrooms, where they will apply their newly acquired skills and actively contribute to the growth of the organization for a period of three months.

NAMIP Media Product Fellowship Program

  • Type: College School
  • Organisation: Nigeria Media Innovation Program’s (NAMIP’s)
  • Country to study: Nigeria
  • School to study –
  • Course to study: Not specified
  • State of Origin: 
  • Gender: Men and Women
  • Application Deadline: June 10, 2024

Aim and Benefits of NAMIP Media Product Fellowship Program

The intervention is necessitated by the dearth of specific product and targeted business skills to serve independent media organisations. Thus, the purpose of the fellowship is to build these skills among media professionals at almost foundational level.

Requirements for NAMIP Media Product Fellowship Program Qualification

This fellowship is for early to mid-stage media professionals who have a good understanding of journalistic best practices but wish to strengthen their knowledge of the news product strategy and media business.

Specifically; candidates must:

  • Have at least 3 years of experience working or interfacing in the media space or related fields.
  • Be able to participate full-time in a three-week long training program.
  • Be able to possibly intern in media organisations for at least 3 months.
  • Share a 500-word essay outlining an understanding of the media landscape, challenges, and the prospects and how a news product and business mindset can strengthen independent media organisations in Nigeria.

Application Deadline

June 10, 2024

How to Apply

Interested and qualified? Go to Nigeria Media Innovation Program’s (NAMIP’s) on airtable.com to apply

Application closes on the 10th of June 2024 and successful candidates will be contacted by the end of June 2024.

For more details,visit NAMIP website
